column4: i have a problem with ubuntu 8.10. I've installed it on an acer 5930g and after update it doesn't recognize my wireless card anymore...know anything??
did you have to do anything to get the car recogniced when you installed ubuntu?
what wifi card it is ? « lspci | grep -i net » should tell you
02:00.0 Ethernet controller: Marvell Technology Group Ltd. 88E8071 PCI-E Gigabit Ethernet Controller (rev 16)
thats the wired one... no other result ?
ooops  Wireless WiFi Link 5100 <<< that's it...
when you do "iwlist" no wlan0 shows up?
no,no wlan0 shows
« lsmod | grep iwlagn » returns anything ?
i get this
please use a pastebin if the output is more than 2-3 lines
-> http://pastebin.com/d33a607bd
i see that the driver got loaded but still no wlan0 :|
dunno :|
try installing the backported drivers...
sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-$(uname -r)
after that??reboot??
yep although « sudo modprobe -r iwlagn && sudo modprobe iwlagn » may work too
i get errors with sudo manprobe.i'll try rebooting
nothing,it still doesn't recognize my wireless card
:| i can not help further... maybe posting a bug report (it is a kernel bug) helps
